com.wizzer.mle.runtime.util

Class MleHeapArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wizzer.mle.runtime.util.MleElementArray
      • com.wizzer.mle.runtime.util.MleHeapArray
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MleHeapsortArray, MlePriorityQueue

    public abstract class MleHeapArray
extends MleElementArray
    This class contains a heap tree and result list. It provides the following functionality:
    • specialized access methods to elements
    • test for emptiness of heaptree
    • swap

      • heapTreeString

        protected java.lang.StringBuffer heapTreeString()

      • buildHeap

        protected void buildHeap()
        Build the heap order for the whole tree.

      • heapify

        protected void heapify(int k)
        Heapify the subtree located at index k.

        Precondition: both of k's child trees are heap ordered.

        Parameters:
        k - The index of the subtree.

      • heapifyLocally

        protected int heapifyLocally(int k)
        Heap order element k with respect to both its children.
        Parameters:
        k - The index of the subtree.
        Returns:
        If keys had to be swapped, return the element where k.m_key now is. Otherwise, null will be returned.

      • moveMax

        protected int moveMax()
        Move the maximum node from the heap into the result list.

        Precondition: the tree must be a heap.

        Returns:
        Return index where node was placed in result list

      • heapEmpty

        protected boolean heapEmpty()
        Determine if heap is empty.
        Returns:
        true is returned if the heap is empty. Otherwise, false is returned.

      • decrementHeapsize

        protected void decrementHeapsize()
        A node has been moved out of the heap. Register this by decrementing the heapsize counter.

      • incrementHeapsize

        protected void incrementHeapsize()
        Increment the heap size.

      • lastInnerElement

        protected int lastInnerElement()
        Get the last inner element in the tree.
        Returns:
        Return last inner element (has no children) in heap, nullIndex is returned if there is no such element.

      • at

        protected int at(int index)
        Utiltiy for determining validity of index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to test.
        Returns:
        If index is in heap, return it unchanged, otherwise return nullIndex.

      • predesessor

        protected int predesessor(int k)
        Get the predessor of the specified element.
        Parameters:
        k - The index of the element to get the predessor of.
        Returns:
        Return the predessor of element k in storage order, nullIndex is returned if k is the root.

      • leftChild

        protected int leftChild(int k)
        Get the child on the left of the heap tree.
        Parameters:
        k - The index of the parent element.
        Returns:
        Return left child of element k, nullIndex if there is no such child.

      • rightChild

        protected int rightChild(int k)
        Get the child on the right of the heap tree.
        Parameters:
        k - The index of the parent element.
        Returns:
        Return right child of element k, nullIndex if there is no such child.

      • parent

        protected int parent(int k)
        Get the parent element of the specified element as index k.
        Parameters:
        k - The index of the element to get the parent of.
        Returns:
        Return parent element of element k. Return nullIndex if k is the root.

      • maxChild

        protected int maxChild(int k)
        Get the child with the highest priority.

        Precondition: heap must be complete.

        Parameters:
        k - The element to obtain the child from.
        Returns:
        Return the bigger child of element k. Return nullIndex if k is a leaf.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the queue.
